intro: Scutellaria chitrovoi, commonly known as the Chitrovo's bluebugloss, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and spikes of small, tubular blue to purple flowers. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
